news.title: Sobha posts net profit of ₹13.61 crore in Q1 FY26
news.para: Sobha has announced a significant surge in its financial performance. The company's net consolidated profit witnessed a substantial increase. It grew by 124.96 percent during the quarter ended June 30, 2025. Profit after tax reached ₹13.61 crore in Q1 FY26.

news.title: Aadhar Housing Finance's net profit up 18.56% in Q1 FY26
news.para: Aadhar Housing Finance reported a robust Q1 FY26, showcasing an 18.56% increase in net consolidated profit, reaching ₹237.28 crore. The company's total income grew by 19.38% to ₹851.34 crore, driven by strong demand in the affordable housing segment.

news.title: Home First Finance Company's net profit rises 35.47% in Q1 FY26
news.para: Home First Finance Company India reveals a 35.47% net profit surge for the quarter ending June 30, 2025. Profit after tax reaches ₹118.89 crore. Total income climbs to ₹455.26 crore. Assets under management rise to ₹13,479 crore. The company successfully completes a QIP of ₹1,250 crore. Credit rating upgrades to AA (Stable).

news.title: Gravity Bath looks to touch ₹1,000 crore by FY29
news.para: Gravity Bath has announced impressive revenue figures, exceeding ₹200 crore. The company is targeting substantial growth, aiming for ₹1,000 crore by FY 2028–29. Expansion plans include penetrating Tier 1 and 2 cities.

news.title: Arkade Developers' net profit declines 4.83% in Q1 FY26
news.para: Arkade Developers announced its Q1 FY26 results. The company's net profit declined by 4.83 percent. It stood at ₹28.75 crore. However, total income increased by 31.64 percent to ₹165.22 crore. Pre-sales grew by 17.1 percent. Collections rose by 41.8 percent.

news.title: Elan Group repays ₹875 crore to Asia Pragati ahead of schedule
news.para: Elan Group has repaid its ₹875 crore debt to Asia Pragati Strategic Investment Fund. The investment was made in 2022. The funds were used for growth capital. This move will reduce interest liabilities. It will also strengthen liquidity for the company.

news.title: Mahindra Lifespaces posts net profit of ₹51.26 crore in Q1 FY26
news.para: Mahindra Lifespace Developers announced a net profit of ₹51.26 crore for the first quarter of fiscal year 2026. The company's income was ₹40.61 crore. A rights issue improved the balance sheet. Gross development value additions reached ₹3,500 crore. Residential pre-sales were ₹449 crore. The IC&IC business saw healthy leasing activity in Jaipur and Chennai.

news.title: Toto India aims to reach turnover of ₹500 crore in FY26
news.para: Toto India Industries, a Toto Group company, reports a 20% growth. The company targets ₹500 crore turnover by FY26. Yusuke Sasaya is the new unit head. Toto plans expansion in premium hospitality projects, high-end residences and commercial spaces. The company operates with 120-140 dealers across India. Its Halol, Gujarat plant produces five lakh sanitary ware pieces annually.

news.title: Orient Electric's net profit increases by 22.18% in Q1 FY26
news.para: Orient Electric announced a 22.18% increase in net consolidated profit for Q1 FY26, reaching ₹17.52 crore. The company's total income grew by 1.88% to ₹771.56 crore, driven by a 7% growth in the lighting and switchgear segment.

news.title: Owners of properties stuck in gunthewari hope for regularisation as Maharashtra scraps act
news.para: Thousands of property owners in Pune may soon find relief as the Maharashtra government has repealed the Tukde Bandi law, potentially regularizing gunthewari properties. This move aims to allow registration, building permits, and property rights for land divisions up to one guntha made before January 1, 2025.

news.title: Danda panchayat secretary suspended over housing scheme irregularities
news.para: In Garhwa, Danda panchayat secretary Shambhu Prasad faced suspension. Deputy commissioner Dinesh Kumar Yadav took action due to alleged irregularities. Prasad reportedly included ineligible individuals in Abua Aawas Yojana during 2023-24.

news.title: Embassy REIT raises ₹2,000 crore through a 10-year NCD issuance
news.para: Embassy Office Parks REIT successfully garnered ₹2,000 crore through a 10-year non-convertible debenture, featuring a coupon of 7.33%. The funds will be strategically deployed to refinance existing debt, leading to anticipated annual interest savings of around 70 basis points. The issuance witnessed strong demand, with oversubscription by 1.4 times from leading institutional investors.

news.title: Over 300 get PMAY houses in Basant Kunj, Lucknow
news.para: The lottery process for allocating 1,000 PMAY housing units in Lucknow's Basant Kunj scheme commenced on Thursday and will continue for three days. On the first day, 307 applicants were allotted homes in Sector-I, with allotments prioritized for reserved categories like SC, ST, OBC, Divyangjan, and senior citizens.

news.title: Pay property tax by July 31 to avail benefits: Ludhiana civic body chief
news.para: Ludhiana residents have one week left to pay pending property taxes without incurring interest or penalties under the one-time settlement (OTS) scheme. MC Commissioner Aaditya Dachalwal urges residents to take advantage of this opportunity by July 31. Zonal suvidha kendras will remain open this weekend to facilitate payments.

news.title: Odisha RERA notifies formation of CDR cell for resolving disputes
news.para: Odisha Real Estate Regulatory Authority (ORERA) has established a Conciliation and Dispute Resolution (CDR) cell to facilitate amicable resolutions between homebuyers and promoters, preventing protracted legal battles. Approved by the housing and urban development department, the cell comprises five members, including representatives from developers' and allottees' associations. Registered allottee associations are invited to nominate a member by July 30, 2025.

news.title: Government decides to regularise B-khata buildings in Bengaluru, leaves out vacant plots
news.para: The Karnataka government has decided to regularize existing B khata buildings and multi-story apartments in Bengaluru constructed on unauthorized layouts, provided they were registered before September 30, 2024. Vacant plots with B khata status are excluded from this regularization. Individual buyers of plots from unauthorized subdivisions may be eligible for a khata under specific conditions.

news.title: Thirteen illegal colonies built on 40 acres demolished in week-long drive in Gurugram
news.para: Gurugram's Department of Town and Country Planning (DTCP) conducted demolition drives across 13 unauthorized colonies, targeting illegal urban development. Supported by local police, the DTCP cleared over 40 acres of illegally carved-out colonies and razed more than 50 structures between July 18 and July 23.

news.title: Chettinad Cement, JK Lakshmi in race to acquire Deccan Cements
news.para: Deccan Cements, with an expected operational capacity of 4 million tonnes by the end of this year, is seeking an enterprise value of $360 million (Rs 3,110 crore) for the company, said the people aware of the discussions. That translates into about $90 for each tonne of capacity.

news.title: Chennai civic body clears two lakh tonnes of building waste in six months
news.para: Greater Chennai Corporation has removed 2 lakh tonnes of construction and demolition waste across all 15 city zones in the past six months. Supported by Premier Precision Surface, the initiative uses 168 vehicles to clear approximately 1,000 tonnes of waste daily, which is then recycled into paver blocks. New disposal guidelines are in effect, with fines issued to violators.

news.title: Bombay HC directs Maharashtra RERA to restore hybrid hearings within four weeks
news.para: Bombay High Court has instructed MahaRera to reinstate hybrid hearings within four weeks, allowing parties the option of physical or virtual appearances. The court emphasized that access to justice includes the right to appear physically. MahaRera has also been directed to review its procedures for urgent listing, order execution, and pronouncements.
